title.rendered: Response to ayesha mocking others: sahih sanad

content.rendered:
The following is a response to SlaveOfAhlubait’s “ayesha mocking others: sahih sanad”. The article can be found on his blog and the Wilayat website.

 

The article contains the following narration:

“ayesha says that once i started mockery of a man or a woman in the presence of holy propet asws, so he said that if i get something even more in return, i will not mock anyone nor i like mockery; i said that safia is this much, and then i pointed of her being dwarf/short heighted; upon this prophet asws said that you have said something which if mixed with water of sea, it will change colour of that”

{molvi zafar iqbal mentions there that narration is sahih as per Albany and hasan sahih as per timidhi}

[musnad ahmad, urdu, vol 11, page 419-420]

 

There is little doubt of the authenticity of this report, though we find it to be an indication of the honesty of A’isha. It is not a common act for one to speak of their own faults, and in this narration, A’isha confesses that the Prophet – peace be upon him – reprimanded her for backbiting.

We do not find any other narrations in which A’isha backbites others, so one cannot say that this was her nature. We also do not find others narrating similar events, which leads us to the conclusion that if A’isha never admitting that she sinned, then it would not have been known.

It is also important to keep in mind that narration illustrates an A’isha that is in her later years, perhaps in her fifties or sixties, who is looking back at her actions as a teenager, and sharing the words of the Prophet – peace be upon him – as a lesson to all, while using herself as an example of the culprit.

For more on the merits of A’isha, refer to our article: The Praise of pro-Ali Companions for A’isha.
